The Administrative Intern will support the daily operations of the organization by handling administrative tasks, maintaining proper documentation, and assisting with internal coordination. This role is ideal for someone detail-oriented, organized, and interested in learning how nonprofit operations are run from the inside.

The Communications Intern will support the creation, management, and dissemination of content across the organization’s platforms. You will assist in amplifying the organization’s voice, documenting impact stories, engaging audiences on social media, and supporting media and advocacy campaigns.

The Finance Intern will support the finance team in maintaining accurate financial records, preparing financial reports, and ensuring compliance with internal financial procedures. This role provides practical experience in nonprofit financial management and accountability systems.

The Research Intern will support data collection, analysis, and documentation of insights for program development, advocacy, and monitoring and evaluation. This role is ideal for someone with strong analytical skills and a keen interest in development research, policy, and impact assessment.

The Graphics Intern will support the design and visual communication needs of the organization, helping to create compelling and consistent content for campaigns, events, reports, and social media. This role is ideal for a creative individual who is passionate about using design to tell stories and drive impact.

The Tech Intern will support the organization’s technology needs, including maintaining digital platforms, assisting with data systems, and supporting tech-related project components. This role is ideal for someone with an interest in tech-for-development, digital innovation, and nonprofit tech solutions.
